name: places/ChIJn_xme8JYwokRn7tMojU2eJ8
adrFormatAddress: 1229 1st Ave., New York, NY 10065, USA

editorialSummary.text: Bustling hub for bagels, various spreads & lox plus other baked goods presented in compact quarters.

originalText.text: This was actually only my second time having a bagel, FIRST as a sandwich. When I say it was delicious, understand, it was yesterday, and my mouth waters at the thought of it still. Space is tight in this small establishment, but it is well worth the few minutes of claustrophobic panic to get these bagels from this place. 100% recommend this place. If you go, PLEASE get me the bomb bagel ðŸ¥¯ ðŸ˜‹

originalText.text:
Iâ€™ve been their customer for 10+ years. Their bagels are always fresh and delicious! Egg salad, cream cheese, coffee, hash brown, sandwiches and their muffins are the best and AGAIN fresh!
Their double chocolate chip muffin is delightfully tasty!
Their customer service is top notch. They always double check with the order if there is anything else we would like to add onto.

originalText.text:
Went Saturday morning for two bagels. I tried a gluten free but it just wasnâ€™t my preference. The lox cream cheese was delicious and there was plenty of it. My cousin had a garlic bagel with plain cream cheese and said it was very good. I love the vat of bagels being boiled right in the back and the oven right there in sight. Not low priced but worth it.

I got bagels and cream cheese again and they never disappoint!

originalText.text: Manhattan bagel shop at its finest. A "hole in the wall" style shop that cranks out fresh bagels by the minute right in front of you. As for my bacon egg & cheese, the whole wheat bagel was a bit more dense than what I like in a bagel, but not short on delicious. A niced sized bagel too.

text.text: Manhattan bagel shop at its finest. A "hole in the wall" style shop that cranks out fresh bagels by the minute right in front of you. As for my bacon egg & cheese, the whole wheat bagel was a bit more dense than what I like in a bagel, but not short on delicious. A niced sized bagel too.

originalText.text:
It brings me no joy to say this because I really have nowhere else to get bagels: Bagelworks bagels are extremely mediocre bagels by NY standards. I know this is a good neighborhood place with a loyal following. I know the atmosphere is authentic. That's what makes this review so unpleasant for me. But ultimately the bagels are just not good. The hole is too big, the bagels are small, they aren't at all chewy, they have no body, they collapse when you pick them up, the taste is so-so. In short, I feel almost like I'm eating regular old bread with poppy seeds splattered on top. I've even had some borderline raw bagels here.

That being said, every other bagel joint in the area is even worse, so I will reluctantly continue to patronize this establishment. I leave this review not to vent but to hopefully give the owners some ideas about how they can further cement their status as the best bagel-meisters of the east 60s.
